What is tTJS

　TJS2 script engine class. You can operate TJS2 through objects of this class.

constructor

　The tTJS constructor has no arguments.
　tTJS objects cannot be created as automatic variables. It must be created using the new operator.
　The reference counter immediately after creation is 1. This means that if you just call the Release method, the tTJS object will be released.

Destructor

　The tTJS destructor is in protection and cannot be accessed.
　To release a tTJS object, use the Release method.
　It is recommended to call the Shutdown method before releasing the tTJS object.

AddRef

void tTJS::AddRef()

　Increments the reference counter of the TJS2 script engine.

Release

void tTJS::Release()

　Decrements the reference counter of the TJS2 script engine.
　When the reference counter reaches zero, the tTJS object is released.

Shutdown

void tTJS::Shutdown()

　Shut down the script engine.

　When releasing the TJS2 script engine, it is recommended that this method be called before the Release method.

GetGlobal

iTJSDispatch2 * tTJS::GetGlobal()

　Get global object. An object of type iTJSDispatch2 interface is returned.
　When this method returns a global object, it increments its reference counter.

GetGlobalNoAddRef

iTJSDispatch2 * tTJS::GetGlobalNoAddRef()

　Get a global object. Unlike GetGlobal, it does not increment the reference counter of the global object.

SetConsoleOutput

void tTJS::SetConsoleOutput(iTJSConsoleOutput *console);

　Specify the output destination of console.
　The console is where error messages from TJS2 are output.

It has the following arguments:

console
　Specifies an object of type iTJSConsoleOutput that defines the output destination for the console.
　iTJSConsoleOutput type is a basic abstract class defined in tjs.h and has the following methods.

void iTJSConsoleOutput::ExceptionPrint(const tjs_char *msg)
　This method outputs information about exceptions. msg represents the message.
void iTJSConsoleOutput::Print(const tjs_char *msg)
　A method for outputting other information. msg represents the message.

GetConsoleOutput

tTJSConsoleOutput * tTJS::GetConsoleOutput() const

　Gets the output destination of the console.

OutputToConsole

void tTJS::OutputToConsole(const tjs_char *msg) const

　Prints a string to the console. msg is the message to be output.

OutpuExceptionToConsole

void tTJS::OutpuExceptionToConsole(const tjs_char *msg) const

　Prints the exception string to the console. msg is the message to be output.

OutputToConsoleWithCentering

void tTJS::OutputToConsoleWithCentering(const tjs_char *msg, tjs_uint width) const

　Centers the string on the console and outputs it. msg is the message to be output and width is the width.
　If the number of characters of the message to be output is smaller than the width, it is centered at the specified width and output (However, the width of all characters is assumed to be the same, so if full-width characters are mixed, the display will be broken.)

OutputToConsoleSeparator

void tTJS::OutputToConsoleSeparator(const tjs_char *text, tjs_uint count) const

　Output count delimiters indicated by text to the console.

Dump

void tTJS::Dump(tjs_uint width = 80) const

　Outputs the status of TJS2 to the console.
　Displays the disassembly result of the virtual machine code in each script block.
　For width, specify the width to output.

ExecScript

void tTJS::ExecScript(
    const tjs_char *script,
    tTJSVariant *result = NULL,
    iTJSDispatch2 *context = NULL,
    const tjs_char *name = NULL,
    tjs_int lineofs = 0
    )

void tTJS::ExecScript(
    const ttstr &script,
    tTJSVariant *result = NULL,
    iTJSDispatch2 *context = NULL,
    const tjs_char *name = NULL,
    tjs_int lineofs = 0
    )

　Execute the script.

　It has the following arguments:

const tjs_char *script
const ttstr &script
　Specify the script to be executed.
tTJSVariant *result
　Pointer to a variable of type tTJSVariant to receive the result.
　You can specify NULL, but if it is NULL you will not receive the result.
iTJSDispatch2 *context
　Specifies the context in which this script runs.
　If you specify NULL, the script runs in the global context.
　Normally, specify NULL, but if you want to execute the script in a specific context, specify the object that will be the context.
const tjs_char *name
　Specify a name for the script. Usually, specify the file name of the script.
　This is used to notify the script where the exception occurred when reporting the exception.
tjs_int lineofs
　Specify the starting line (starting at 0) of the script in the script.
　Specify the start line of the TJS script when the TJS script is embedded in other documents like the TJS script embedded in the KAG scenario.
　This is used to notify the script where the exception occurred when reporting the exception.

EvalExpression

void tTJS::EvalExpression(
    const tjs_char *expression,
    tTJSVariant *result = NULL,
    iTJSDispatch2 *context = NULL,
    const tjs_char *name = NULL
    tjs_int lineofs = 0
    )

void tTJS::EvalExpression(
    const ttstr &expression,
    tTJSVariant *result = NULL,
    iTJSDispatch2 *context = NULL,
    const tjs_char *name = NULL
    tjs_int lineofs = 0
    )

　Evaluate the expression.
　See ExecScript for arguments.

　For operators that cannot obtain the result of an expression, such as the if operator, an exception will be raised if you specify non-NULL for result in an attempt to obtain the result. In this case, NULL must be specified for result.

SetPPValue

void tTJS::SetPPValue(const tjs_char *name, const tjs_int32 value)

　Set the variables for condition compilation. name is the name of the variable and value is the value to set.

GetPPValue

tjs_int32 tTJS::GetPPValue(const tjs_char *name)

　Gets variables for conditional compilation. name is the name of the variable. Returns 0 if the variable is not found.

DoGarbageCollection

tjs_int32 tTJS::DoGarbageCollection()

　Performs garbage collection. Clears the cache held by TJS2 and completes unprocessed cleanup processing.
